qas.question: When did von NEumann establish mean square ratio?
How has mean square ratio been applied?
what does null hypothesis test against?

answers.text: alternative that they follow a stationary first order autoregression

context: Von Neumann made fundamental contributions to mathematical statistics. In <a0_0>1941<a0_0/>, he derived the exact distribution of the ratio of the mean square of successive differences to the sample variance for independent and identically normally distributed variables. This ratio was applied to the residuals from regression models and is commonly known as the <a1_0>Durbin–Watson statistic<a1_0/> for testing the null hypothesis that the errors are serially independent against the <a2_0>alternative that they follow a stationary first order autoregression<a2_0/>.
